entries: All creatures of the multiverse have a natural form. Those that would seek to physically alter their form or obscure it with magic must be reprimanded.

items.name: Swift Retribution
entries: Those who break the laws of the multiverse deserve a punishment to fit their crime. A thief may lose a hand, but an oathbreaker may forfeit their life.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Divine Interrogation
entries: As an action, you can grasp your holy symbol and force a creature you can see within 10 feet, to make an Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the true name of the creature and it has disadvantage on the first Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you force it to make within the next minute.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Unexpected Inquisition
entries: On your first turn after rolling initiative, you can use a bonus action to hold aloft your holy symbol and force a number of creatures of your choice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, creatures that have not yet taken a turn since rolling initiative are surprised.

subclassFeature.name: Unstoppable Inquisition
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you do not tolerate those who would stand in the way of your quest for truth. Once per turn, when you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee attack, you can force them to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are knocked {@condition prone}, in addition to the normal damage.
At 18th level, this ability can also effect Huge creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Will
entries: You have honed your mind to resist any effects that would restrict your agency or obscure the truth for you. Starting at 15th level, you are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

subclassFeature.name: Grand Inquisitor
entries: Upon reaching 20th level, you can use your action to become a divine embodiment of absolute Truth and Law. When you do so, you gain the benefits listed below for one minute:

items: You gain {@sense truesight} out to a 120-foot radius.
All of your attacks trigger your Unstoppable Inquisition.
Any shapechanger hit by one of your attacks reverts to its original form and takes an additional {@dice 2d8} radiant damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Liberty
entries: The Oath of Liberty calls paladins to use their power to stand with the oppressed against tyranny. It is not enough to enact justice, but to see that justice is fairly applied to all. Paladins of Liberty are often despised by those who have seized power through nefarious means. Seen as threats to the established order, those who swear this Oath and are often persecuted.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Liberty
entries: A paladin of Liberty often emblazons their oath upon their shield and refuses to hide or obscure what they stand for.

items.name: Equality
entries: Birth, wealth, and status do not matter. Everyone is equal in your eyes. The mighty should be made low, and the lowly raised up. All people should have access to their basic needs, regardless of their birth, status, or wealth.

items.name: Freedom
entries: Every creature has a right to be free and equal under the law of the land. Bring freedom to those who are enslaved and bring justice to those who abuse their power.

entries.caption: Oath of Liberty Spells
rows: {@spell aura of purity}, {@spell freedom of movement}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Admonish the Tyrannical
entries: As a reaction when a creature deals damage to a creature within 30 feet, you can grasp your holy symbol to rebuke them. For the next minute, the attacker has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Shield the Meek
entries: As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can grasp your holy symbol, and grant it a bonus to their Armor Class equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1), possibly turning the attack into a miss. This bonus lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Solidarity
entries: The strength of your convictions protects those who stand alongside you. Starting at 7th level, when an allied creature within 10 feet of you takes damage, the damage is reduced by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
At 18th level the range of this ability increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shelter the Innocent
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action, so long as the target is within your Aura of Solidarity.

subclassFeature.name: Heroic Sacrifice
entries: You can enact the ultimate sacrifice, laying down your life for your allies. At 20th level, you can use an action to distribute your remaining hit points and spell slots among creatures within 60 feet of you, following the rules below:

items: You can divide hit points and spell slots in any increment, among any creatures of your choice within range.
Any hit points you give to creatures that go over their hit point maximum become temporary hit points for them.
For a creature to receive one of your spell slots, they must have an expended a spell slot of the same level or lower.

entries: Immediately after you distribute your remaining hit points and spell slots you fall to zero hit points, and are unconscious but stabilized. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Mysticism
entries: Where most paladins swear Oaths to a divine cause or ideal, some swear an Oath to themselves, vowing to awaken their own inner power. Known as Mystic Knights, these paladins spend years in secluded places, mastering the psionic power that lies dormant within their own mind. Once their mind has been awakened, these psionic warriors venture out into the world looking to bring enlightenment to all they meet.

entries.name: Optional Rule: Psionic Spellcasting
entries: For mechanics to match the fantasy of a paladin who uses their inner psionic power to cast spells, replace your Charisma saving throw proficiency, spellcasting ability, multiclassing prerequisites, and any other Charisma-based features from your class or the Oath of Mysticism with Intelligence.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Mysticism
entries: Mystic Knights are extremely disciplined, and live their lives by a strict ascetic code in order to awaken their inner power:

items.name: Ascetism
entries: In order to draw out the full psionic potential of your mind you must forgo all worldly attachments. Family ties, material wealth, all stand in they way of the mystical.

items.name: Enlightenment
entries: You must always strive to become the best version of yourself. True enlightenment is realizing your full potential, and helping others to discover their true selves.

items.name: Knowledge
entries: The ability to reason is what separates mortals from beasts and monsters. Knowledge is the only treasure that can bring one closer to true enlightenment.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Enlightened Spell
entries: When you cast one of your Oath of Mysticism Spells, you can invoke this Channel Divinity to cast it without providing verbal or somatic components, and only material components if they are consumed by the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Psionic Smite
entries: When you use your Divine Smite, you can invoke this Channel Divinity. The additional damage of Divine Smite becomes psychic damage, and the creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, its speed is halved and it cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Enlightenment
entries: Your awakened mind exudes a psionic ward. Beginning at 7th level, friendly creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you gain resistance to psychic damage, and have advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Rebuke
entries: Starting at 15th level, when a creature within your Aura of Enlightenment hits you with an attack, they take psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Ascension
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to briefly unleash your mind and take on an ascended luminous form. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You become translucent and emit otherworldly bright light, in a 5-foot radius, and dim light 5 feet beyond that.
You gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed.
You gain immunity to psychic damage.

You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your movement inside another object or creature, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@dice 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Prosperity
entries: Not all paladins pursue lives of virtue or nobility. Some more worldly paladins swear an Oath of Prosperity and dedicate their lives to amassing great material wealth. Often hailing from the merchant class, or acting in the service of a great dragon, Prosperity paladins value gold over all else. To them, each action, decision, and even each life, has a value in gold.

While all those who follow the Oath of Prosperity do look out for themselves, not all operate for entirely selfish reasons. Some see material wealth, and the power that comes with it, as the most direct path to enacting change in the world.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Prosperity
entries: Paladins who swear this Oath adhere to a code that allows them to generate wealth. While some strictly follow the code, others have a more loose view of what constitutes wealth.

items.name: Benefit
entries: Before you act, you must analyze any possible benefits you could gain, whether material wealth or favors.

items.name: Investment
entries: View everything you do as an investment. Your actions should have a pay off for you at some point in the future. Debt is a powerful force to wield over another.

items.name: Profit
entries: Never enter into a bad deal. Each agreement that you take part in must eventually increase your ability to grow your power, influence, wealth, or overall standing in society.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Distilled Fortune
entries: As an action, you can touch your holy symbol to a Large or smaller non-magical object, that is not being worn or carried. It is transfigured into a tiny precious gemstone worth the exact monetary value of the item.
As an action, a creature can crush the gemstone, causing the object to reappear on an empty flat surface within 5 feet.
You can have a total number of objects transfigured in this way equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you can't use this Channel Divinity while at your maximum.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Vault of Prosperity
entries: When you cast a spell that requires a material component with a gold cost, you can invoke this Channel Divinity to reduce the required cost of the material component by an amount of gold equal to 50 times your level.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Prosperity
entries: Your presence increases the value of spells that aid allies you are invested in. Starting at 7th level, when an allied creature within 10 feet is targeted by a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points, or grants them temporary hit points, they gain additional hit points, or temporary hit points, equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Fortunate Defense
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can liquidate your investments to protect you from harm. As a reaction when you take damage from a creature you can see, you can crush a gem you gained from Distilled Fortune, and reduce the incoming damage by {@dice 1d10} for each 100 gold the Distilled Fortune gem is worth.
For example, a Distilled Fortune gem that is worth 500 gold would reduce the incoming damage by {@dice 5d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Golden Guardian
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to take on the form of a Golden Guardian, a true paragon of Prosperity. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your level.
As a bonus action on each turn, you can grant a creature within your Aura of Prosperity temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).
While you, or any creature, has temporary hit points from this feature they gain a golden sheen and are resistant to all bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Shield
entries: While most paladins are known for the wrath they pour out upon their foes, those who swear the Oath of the shield use their power to defend. Known as Divine Shields, these noble warriors stand as protectors of the innocent and defenseless. Bravely placing themselves between their allies and danger, a Shield paladin is an invaluable ally to have on the battlefield.

entries.name: Shield Warrior Fighting Style
entries: The Shield Warrior Fighting Style is available to paladins who wish to take the Oath of the Shield:

entries.name: Shield Warrior
entries: Shields count as martial melee weapons for you. On hit, they deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d4} + your Strength modifier. If you are wielding a shield and nothing in your other hand, you gain a +1 bonus to your Armor Class and to damage rolls with your shield attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Shield
entries: Paladins of the Shield become one with the armament from which they draw their name, and their Oath reflects that:

items.name: Immovable Bastion
entries: When you make a choice, you must stand by your decision. When you vow to defend another, you must stand by them no matter the dangers you may face.

items.name: Shield of the Innocent
entries: You are a shield for the defenseless. Power has been given to you so that you may protect those who cannot protect themselves, especially those who don't know how to fight or are unjustly made victims of violence.

entries.caption: Oath of the Shield Spells
rows: {@spell protection from energy}, {@spell leomund's tiny hut}
{@spell circle of power}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Divine Aegis
entries: As an action, you can hold aloft your holy symbol and project a shining protective aura that extends in a 10-foot radius from you, which lasts until you move. Any creature within this radius gains the benefits of half cover.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Holy Abjuration
entries: As a reaction when you take damage from a spell or another magical effect, you can grasp your holy symbol and invoke this Channel Divinity. The damage you would take from the spell or magical effect is reduced by an amount equal to your paladin level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If this reduces the damage of the spell or effect to zero, the entire spell or effect is dispelled.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Defense
entries: Your force of will can deflect blows that would harm those who fight by your side. Starting at 7th level, when a creature within 10 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the creature's Armor Class against the triggering attack.
At 18th level the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Adamant Stance
entries: Once you take your stand there is nothing that can force you to move. Starting at 15th level, you cannot be moved against your will. Also, when you are forced to make an ability check to resist being {@condition grappled} you can add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of your ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Bulwark
entries: At 20th level, you can use your action to exude the ultimate Divine Aegis of protection in a 30-foot radius from you. When you do so, you gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: You gain temporary hit points equal to your paladin level.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your paladin level.
Creatures within range gain the benefits of half cover.
When a creature within range takes damage, you can choose to take the damage in place of them.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: The Oathless
entries: Not all paladins are able to hold to their Sacred Oaths. Some break their Oath and fall into evil, becoming Blackguards and Oathbreakers, but not all who falter become paragons of evil. Known as the Oathless, paladins who abandon their divinely appointed cause for reasons other then evil still retain some of their power. They wander the wilds as lost warriors, often becoming bandits and mercenaries. Some quest for purpose, seeking to renew their Oath, while others fall into despair.

entries.name: Breaking a Sacred Oath
entries: The difficulty of breaking a Sacred Oath can vary by table and style of play. Depending on the paladin's transgression, a small ritual or penance may be all that is needed to keep their power, but other times their Oath has been broken beyond forgiveness.

When a Paladin breaks their Sacred Oath in such a definitive manner, there are only two options to move forward as a paladin: turn to evil and become an Oathbreaker or blackguard, or remain neutral, or even good, as the Oathless paladin detailed here.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Oathless
entries: An Oathless paladin owes allegiance to no one. They hold to no tenets and are loyal to nothing but themselves. Oathless paladins are often selfish, with their own safety and power being their only concern. These lost warriors won't hesitate to obtain what they desire, even at the expense of others.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Coward's Escape
entries: As a bonus action, you grasp your holy symbol and force a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target cannot perceive you in any way for up to 1 minute. They can't see, hear, smell, or sense your presence in any way. This ends early if you attack the creature or target them with a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Selfish Restoration
entries: When you begin your turn you can invoke this Channel Divinity (no action required) to end one of the following conditions currently affecting you: {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned}. Alternatively, you can choose to immediately regain hit points equal to your paladin level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Devious Counter
entries: You have learned to disable foes who threaten you. Starting at 7th level, when a creature misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is knocked {@condition prone} and its movement speed is reduced to zero until the start of your next turn.
Upon reaching 18th level, you can use this feature an unlimited amount of times without using your reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Will
entries: Beginning at 15th level, when you force a creature within 15 feet of you to make a saving throw to resist the effects of an enchantment spell, they have disadvantage on their roll.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Dishonor
entries: At 20th level, you can use an action to become a shade of a righteous paladin, gaining the benefits below for 1 minute:

items: You become {@condition invisible}.
You can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.
When a creature misses you with an attack, you can force it to repeat its attack against another creature of your choice within the normal range of its attack.

entries: Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again, unless you spend a spell slot of 5th-level or higher to use it an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Grief
entries: The Oath of Grief shuns false hope and seeks to remind the world of the hollow joke of its existence, its purposelessness, its futility, and its tragic horror. Life may seem good at times, but the only constant is that it will get worse. Comforting lies like love or a greater meaning to one's life which hide the true horror and madness of the world only teach people to swim against the vicious tide of life and drown. Only by accepting the cruel hand we are given can those of the Oath of Grief find the path to what meager existence can be tolerated.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Grief
entries: The brutal realities that the Oath of Grief hold as tenets may be painful but they are better to accept than to deny.

items.name: Expect the Worst
entries: Surviving is about minimizing pain, not finding happiness. Always expect to suffer and faiL and you'll never be disappointed Remind others of this inevitable truth.

items.name: Beware Everyone
entries: Trust is fleeting, false, and foolish. Never forget that everyone lies to themselves, and that you could be betrayed by anyone, especially at their lowest point.

items.name: Let Go of Your Mind
entries: The quest to maintain one's sanity is a futile effort. Embrace the dynamic nature of your mind and accept that you will never truly understand your own depths.

items.name: Reject False Hope
entries: Just as those thrown high into the air will suffer a steep falL those sent high by hope will inevitably crash down all the more hard when the cold reality hits them. Deny hope in yourself and others. Stay safely on the ground

items.name: Life Has No Meaning
entries: Do not believe in such silly lies.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Evoke Malaise
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to remove all purpose and motivation from a creature. As an action, you choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. Fey make this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, the creature can take no actions on its turns. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the creature takes damage the effect ends instantly.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Weight of Despair
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to cover an area in crushing gravity. As an action, choose a point within 60 feet. A 10-foot radius 30-foot tall cylinder of crushing gravity forms with the point as its center for 1 minute. The space within the area is difficult terrain for creatures other than you. Each creature other than you that starts its turn in the area must make a Strength saving throw. Celestials make this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed saving throw, a creature is knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Smite
entries: Starting at 3rd level your Divine Smite deals force damage instead of radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Paranoia
entries: Starting at 7th leveL you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be surprised and have advantage on initiative rolls and ability checks made to sense hidden creatures while you are conscious.
At 18th leveL the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Banish Hope
entries: Starting at 15th leveL creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you that are {@condition prone} have disadvantage on all Wisdom and Charisma saving throws and must make a Wisdom saving throw before attempting to stand up. On a failed saving throw, a creature cannot stand up that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Dread Idol
entries: At 20th level you gain the ability to channel the powers of grief into your very body. As an action, you can transform into an avatar of hopelessness and dread For 1 minute, you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks, and whenever an enemy begins its turn within 100 feet of you it becomes {@condition frightened} of you if it can see you.

Upon being {@condition frightened}, a creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it cannot take actions until the start of its next turn. Each creature remains {@condition frightened} of you until it deals you damage, it makes you roll a saving throw that you faiL or the transformation ends. A creature can only be {@condition frightened} in this way once per transformation.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Love
entries: The Oath of Love is the expression of mankind's oldest comfort. Paladins who take this oath vow to protect the bonds between lovers, family, friends and companions; the bonds that tie and make us who we are, that give us strength in the darkest times and are at the center of the brightest.

Many who pledge themselves to this oath do so to defend those whom they hold dear. Others are more selfless in their honor of the oath, seeking to spread love to those who've scarcely felt it, to play matchmaker and counselor to the forlorn, and to interject and smite any who use false promises of love as a tool to control others.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Love
entries: Though the perceptions of bonds and relationships vary between cultures and peoples, paladins of the Oath of Love rely on the following tenets to help them understand and protect those who share deep connections.

items.name: Acceptance
entries: The bond between willing people may sometimes be shunned by the society they inhabit. Their love, however, is valid and should be respected as any other. People should not be punished for following their heart and being with whom makes them happiest.

items.name: Hope
entries: The kiss of a lover, the embrace of a mother, the smile of a brother; these memories keep us company in their absence and remind us that there are reasons to endure. Promises of better days with those who truly care for us help us push through whatever difficulties we face.

items.name: Kindness
entries: Acts of kindness and gentle words of understanding help soothe the scorned and hurt. Happiness begets happiness, and those who walk unburdened by misery will, in turn, be kinder to another.

items.name: Understanding
entries: There will be conflict between even the most loving people. Putting oneself in the other's position and seeing the matter from their perspective will help in deciding how to proceed in any given situation.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Benevolent Promise
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to form a divine connection with another creature that emboldens and protects you both.

As an action, choose a willing creature within 30 feet of you. As long as you are within line of sight of each other, you and they have advantage on the first attack roll or ability check made on your respective turns.
Additionally, when either of you is targeted with an attack, the other may use their reaction to add their proficiency bonus to the targeted creature's armor class for that attack.
This connection breaks if either of you finishes your turn more than 30 feet apart from the other. Otherwise, it last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Poet's Eloquence
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to help bring to life the words in your heart.
As a bonus action, grant yourself proficiency in Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks and Charisma (Performance) checks for 10 minutes.
If you are already proficient in these skills when you use this Channel Divinity, you double your proficiency bonus for ability checks made with these skills.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Touch
entries: Starting at 7th level, your touch assuages and comforts the ailing.

When you use your Lay on Hands feature, you can spend 5 hit points from your pool of healing to end a condition affecting that creature. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition paralyzed}.
You can end multiple conditions with a single use of your Lay on Hands, spending hit points separately for each one.

subclassFeature.name: Everlasting Bond
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you are able to perform a ritual that deepens the connection between creatures who love one another.

Choose a number of willing creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (this may include yourself), they must be within 30 feet of you during the performance of the ritual; over the course of 24 hours, an extraordinary bond forms between these creatures giving them the following benefits:

items: While in line of sight of each other, bonded creatures can communicate telepathically with one another;
Within a 1 mile radius, bonded creatures know the exact location of the creatures with whom they are bonded;
While in the same plane of existence, bonded creatures may appear in and shape each others dreams;
Bonded creatures may eschew the material components necessary to cast the {@spell Revivify} and {@spell Raise Dead} spells on creatures with whom they are bonded;

entries: A bonded creature may willingly suspend the effects of the bond at any time (no action required). In the same way, a bonded creature may willingly break their bond to one or more of the creatures with whom they are bonded.

Creatures may only partake in this ritual once. If a creature breaks their bond to one or more of the creatures with whom they are bonded, they may ask the paladin who performed the ritual to mend it; however, the bond can only be mended if the creatures who partook in the ritual agree to have their bond reforged with the one who broke it.
Otherwise, this bond lasts for the lifetime of the last living bonded creature.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon of Love
entries: At 20th level, you embody the guarding aspects of love.

As an action, you become a flawless version of yourself in the eyes of those who see you, and you emanate a protective aura in a 30-foot radius. Creatures friendly to you (including yourself) within the aura gain the following benefits:

items: They become resistant to poison and psychic damage;
They gain 10 temporary hit points at the start of their turns;

Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against those protected by the aura, they must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, they suffer a penalty to that roll equal to your proficiency bonus;

entries: While this aura is active, you can use your Lay on Hands ability on any creature within the 30-foot radius as a bonus action.
This aura lasts for 1 minute, or until you dismiss it as a bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Sacrifice
entries: Paladins who swear the Oath of Sacrifice fight on the side of life. Some may be defending their homeland or loved ones. Others might seek to vanquish a great evil in the pursuit of peace. Sometimes called martyrs or blood knights, these paladins commit themselves to shouldering heavy burdens so that others do not have to. They combine their holy powers with blood magic to turn their pain into a potent tool. Victory may demand the ultimate sacrifice, but it is a price they pay gladly.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Sacrifice
entries: The Oath of Sacrifice is always tied to that which is being protected. It requires complete and unselfish fidelity to defending others, and follows these core tenets.

items.name: Life at any Cost
entries: You are sworn to protect the lives of others, and will always value the preservation of innocent life first.

items.name: No Price is Too High
entries: If you must suffer, even die, in the defense of others you will do so without question.

items.name: Bear the Burden
entries: Never allow another to be sacrificed in your stead. You do not bargain with lives not your own.

items.name: Live Well and Die Well
entries: Do not endure pain needlessly. Make sure your sacrifices will reduce the strife and suffering in the world.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Penitent Chain
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to force another creature to share your pain. As a bonus action, you link yourself to a creature within 30 feet for up to 1 minute. The next time you take damage, your target takes necrotic damage equal to the damage you suffered. The effect then ends.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Sanguinary Shield
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to spill your own blood in defense of your allies. As an action, you take damage equal to your paladin level. This damage can't be reduced in any way. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you then gains temporary hit points for 1 minute equal to the damage you took.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Blood
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can tie your life force to those nearby, healing wounds or inflicting pain. When you take damage, choose a creature within 10 feet of you. It either regains hit points or takes necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (your choice).
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Penance
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when you inflict damage with an attack or spell on your turn, you can choose to take damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
You can only use this feature once once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Enduring Wrath
entries: When you reach 15th level, you can channel your pain into a terrible fury. While you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining and aren't {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Righteous Fortitude
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

items.name: Lust for Victory
entries: You add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to your attack and damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Martyrdom
entries: At 20th level, when you are reduced to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to return from the brink of death to save your allies and smite your foes. You stand up and regain 75 hit points. For 1 minute, you are cloaked in a mantle of iridescent red light. The damage and healing from your Aura of Blood are doubled, and any damage you take from your Penance feature is reduced to 1.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Tormented
entries: The Oath of the Tormented was an oath far too many swore. Haunted by their past, paladins who swore this oath could never fully let go of what had happened. A deep darkness grows within them. Some use this darkness as an ally, using it as a tool to defeat their foes. Others swore to never let that darkness touch anybody else. Those who swore the Oath of the Tormented chose both.

entries.subclassFeature: Channel Divinity: Sentinel of the Weak|Paladin|PHB|Tormented|not|3
Channel Divinity: Champion of the Night|Paladin|PHB|Tormented|not|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Tormented
entries: Each Paladin that swears the Oath of the Tormented tailors it to themselves. The event that haunts your past is a deeply personal and sacred thing, and to generalize would be unfitting. Generally, those who swear this oath share these principles.

items.name: Protect Innocence
entries: Some people will never know war, will never take up arms. You must ensure this does not change

items.name: Courage
entries: Most run away from danger. You run towards it, ready to protect those who cannot protect themselves.

items.name: Remembrance
entries: Death is a constant. Those who have passed into the next life cannot be forgotten.

items.name: Crush Evil
entries: Those who wish harm upon the innocent are abominations. They must be exterminated.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Sentinel of the Weak
entries: As a bonus action, you begin to act as a guardian, protecting those who cannot protect themselves. A number of creatures equal to your charisma modifier of your choice within 20 feet of you must make a wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature cannot move farther than 30 feet away from you, and they have disadvantage on attacks against any other creature. These effects last for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Champion of the Night
entries: As a bonus action, you can invoke the power of darkness to be your ally. For 1 minute, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. Additionally, for this duration, you turn bright light to dim light and dim light to darkness within 10 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Night
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your connection with the darkness has grown, allowing you to spread that connection with others. You and friendly creatures within 10 feet gain resistance to cold and necrotic damage, and can see through magical darkness to a range of 30 feet.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Guardian
entries: Starting at 15th level, you are immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition paralyzed} conditions.
In addition, you are also adept at hiding in darkness. While in darkness, you are {@condition invisible} to any creature that relies on darkvision to see you in that darkness.

subclassFeature.name: Hero of the Night
entries: At 20th level, you can become the ultimate defender of the innocent, the bane of evil. Depending on the exact nature of your oath, you might assume a shadowy form, or perhaps enter a state of pure focus.

As an action, you undergo a transformation. At the start of this transformation, choose a number of creatures within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier. These creatures are under the effect of the {@spell sanctuary} spell
For 1 minute, you also gain the following benefits:

items: You become cloaked in darkness, becoming heavily obscured.
You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Remembrance
entries: Paladins who take this oath have a close relationship with death, and the dead. Often they are people who have lost people dear to them. Paladins of remembrance usually dedicate themselves to the preservation of the past, and to the protection of holy sites such as graveyards. However, some of these paladins see it as their sacred duty to set out and find those souls who are trapped on the material plane as ghosts and shades, to try and bring them peace and lay them to rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Remembrance
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Silence are all about secrets.

items.name: Mourn
entries: Honor the fallen.

items.name: Remember
entries: Do not forget the dead.

items.name: Be At Peace
entries: Some spirits of the dead are stuck on the material plane, and need to be brought peace.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Summon Spirit
entries: As a bonus action, you may brandish your holy symbol and call a spirit to aid you in battle. The spirit appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. It uses the {@creature Bonded Spirit|joor} stat block at the end of this subclass, which uses your Proficiency Bonus (PB) in several places, you may choose its appearance. In combat, the spirit shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger. The spirit remains for 10 minutes, after which it fades away.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Ghostly Step
entries: As an action, you may teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You can also bring one willing creature with you that is within 5 feet of you when you use this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Spirits
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can call upon spirits to pull you or your allies partially into the ethereal plane to protect them from harm. As a reaction whenever you or a creature within 15 feet of you that you can see takes bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, you can give that creature resistance to these types of damage until the beginning of your next turn.
At level 18, the range of this feature increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Soul
entries: At 15th level, you may cast the {@spell Etherealness} spell once without consuming a spell slot or material components. After you've done so, you may not do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Fallen
entries: At 20th level, you can become a spirit yourself. As an action you may enter into an incorporeal state. You gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: Your attacks deal an additional {@dice 2d8} necrotic damage.
You have resistance to all damage types.

You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 ({@dice 1d10}) force damage if you end your turn inside an object and are shunted into the next available space.

entries: After you've entered into this state, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th level spell slot to do so.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Empath
entries: One thing that sets mortal creatures above the beasts and monsters is their ability to experience emotions. A rare few are so in tune with their own emotional lives that they can draw out their psionic potential with intense feeling. Known as Empaths, these psions revel in intense emotions, ecstatic joy, intense sorrow, and overwhelming fear which allow them to draw forth the wondrous potential of their minds.

subclassFeature.name: Aura Sight
entries: Your psionic abilities allow you to view the emotional auras of other creatures. These auras appear as shimmering colors that surround a creature, and can be read to determine their current emotions. At 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Insight}. You also add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks and your passive {@skill Insight} score.

As an action, you can attempt to decipher the emotional aura of a creature that you can see. If your passive {@skill Insight} is higher then the creature's Charisma score, you learn if they are currently friendly, indifferent, or hostile towards you.
A creature that is hidden from psionics, divination magic, or having their mind read exudes a neutral emotional aura.
Also, when you make a Charisma check to interact with a creature whose emotional aura you have deciphered, you can spend 1 psi point to grant yourself advantage on your roll.

intro: You learn the following spells at the psion levels noted in the table below. These spells count as psion spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Aura Manipulation
entries: You can psionically manipulate the emotional auras of other creatures. At 3rd level, you gain the following abilities:

items.name: Depress
entries: When you manifest a psion spell that charms or frightens a creature, you can expend additional psi points to impose disadvantage on their initial saving throw. For each additional psi point you expend (up to your Mental Limit) a target of your choice has disadvantage on their initial roll.

items.name: Elate
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and expend psi points to inspire them. It gains {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points for each psi point you expend (up to your Mental Limit).

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Stability
entries: Starting at 6th level, you exude calming emotions. When you or a friendly creature within 10 feet makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, they gain a bonus to their roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Emotional Control
entries: You can cripple the minds of other creatures. Starting at 14th level, when you charm or frighten a creature, you can spend 1 additional psi point to enhance that effect for one target. For the duration, it is {@condition incapacitated} and its movement speed is 0.
Also, you are immune to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Empathic Domination
entries: Your psionic power overwhelms those under your control. Fear becomes crippling terror, and enchantment becomes utter devotion. At 18th level, when you charm or frighten a creature the effect is enhanced in the following ways:

items.name: Charmed
entries: A creature that is {@condition charmed} by you will use any abilities within its power to defend you, regardless of any previous loyalties they may have had before this effect.

items.name: Frightened
entries: A creature {@condition frightened} by you is {@condition stunned} for the duration of their fear as long as they can see you.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Enlightened
entries: Enlightened psions meticulously hone their power through practice and dedication. Whether they studied under a great mystic, or unlocked their power on their own over the course of years, they exercise a much more precise degree of control over their gift when compared to others of similar potential. These mystics have a great respect for the wondrous power of their mind, and due to the years of training required to unlock their true potential, the Enlightened are known for their unrivaled dedication, patience, and tenacity.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: You have unlocked the ability to see with your mind's eye. At 1st level, you gain proficiency in {@skill Perception}, and {@skill Perception} becomes an Intelligence-based skill for you. If you are already proficient in {@skill Perception} you gain proficiency in another skill of your choice from the psion class skill list.

Your minds eye also grants you enhanced sight in a 10-foot radius. Within that radius you have {@sense blindsight} and can see in to the ethereal plane. As an action, you can expend psi points to increase the radius of your enhanced sight, and for each psi point you expend (up to your Mental Limit), the radius of your enhanced sight increases by 10 feet for 1 minute.

intro: You learn the following spells at the psion levels noted in the table below. These spells count as psion spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Precision
entries: Through intense dedication and practice, you learn to utilize your psionic power in subtle ways that are unnoticeable to the untrained eye. Beginning at 3rd level, when you manifest a psion spell you can expend 1 additional psi point to do so without providing any of the somatic or verbal components.
When you manifest a psion spell in this way you show no outward signs of your psionic power.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Psionics
entries: The precise control you exhibit over your inner psionic power enhances the potency of the effects you manifest. Starting at 6th level, when you manifest a psion spell or ability that deals bludgeoning, force, piercing, or psychic damage, you can add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1) to the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Flight
entries: The psionic power of your mind has suffused every fiber of your physical form, allowing you to subvert the laws of the natural world. At 14th level, you gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed. While flying you can hover in place.
While you fly in this way, the air immediately around you shimmers with your psionic power, and rocks, dirt, and other small loose objects rise from the ground to float around you.

subclassFeature.name: Enlightened Form
entries: Staring at 18th level, you can briefly unleash your mind and take on an ascended luminous form. As a bonus action, you can transform your physical body into pure psionic energy. While in this form, you gain the following benefits:

items: You become translucent and emit otherworldly bright light, in a 5-foot radius, and dim light 5 feet beyond that.
You gain resistance to all damage, magical and mundane.

You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your movement inside another object or creature, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@dice 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.

entries: You can remain in this form for up to 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated or you end it as a bonus action. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 5 psi points to do so.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Immortal
entries: Raised from birth to master both body and mind, Immortal psions are extremely difficult to kill. They use their psionic abilities to enhance their bodies and perform great feats of athleticism and martial skill. Immortals spend years honing their psionic combat abilities, making them ideal insurgents, assassins, and body guards, for those that can afford them.

subclassFeature.name: Immortal Training
entries: At 1st level, you gain proficiency with all martial weapons. Your hit point maximum also increases by 1, and increases by 1 again each time you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Esoteric Proficiency
entries: As an Immortal, you can augment your physical abilities with psionic power. At 1st level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Acrobatics}, {@skill Athletics}, {@skill Perception}, {@skill Sleight of Hand}, or {@skill Stealth}. At the end of each long rest, you can switch the proficiency from this ability to another from this list.
When you make an ability check that uses this proficiency, you can expend 1 psi point to use your Intelligence, in place of the normal ability score you would use for that check.

intro: You learn the following spells at the psion levels noted in the table below. These spells count as psion spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Strike
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you can empower your attacks with psionic energy. When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can expend psi points to empower the attack. For each psi point you expend (up to your Mental Limit) your attack deals an additional {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action. Moreover, you can cast one of your psion cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Immortal Will
entries: You have mastered the technique from which Immortals draw their name. Beginning at 14th level, your mind can will you to survive blows that would normally kill you. When you are reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, you can expend 5 psi points to immediately regain hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) + your psion level.

subclassFeature.name: Phase Walk
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can psionically phase through solid objects. When you take the {@action Dash} action, you can expend 1 psi point to enter an ethereal state that lasts until the end of your current turn. While in this state, you can move through solid objects and creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your movement inside an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and take {@dice 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Outsider
entries: Your psionic power may not have been awoken of your own volition. Outsiders are psions whose minds have been twisted by incomprehensible alien powers. Some were touched by the strange light of the Far Realm. Others are the results of cruel experiments of aberration from other worlds and times. Whatever their origin, Outsiders can wield the overwhelming psionic power of aberrations, often at the cost of their sanity.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Transformation
entries: The unknowable presence within your mind will overtake you when you are weak. Starting at 1st level, when you have 0 psi points remaining, you mutate into an Outsider. As an action, you can expend your remaining psi points to mutate at will.

The appearance of your Outsider depends on the source of your aberrant power. All Outsiders are hideous to look upon; even the bravest are unsettled by their unnatural appearance. While in your Outsider form you gain the following features:

items: You can no longer concentrate on spells or other features.
You gain temporary hit points equal to twice your psion level which last for the duration of your transformation.

Your hands mutate into writhing tentacles. You cannot wield weapons, but your tentacles count as simple melee weapons, with which you are proficient. You use your Intelligence modifier for attack and damage rolls with them, and on hit, they deal {@dice 1d6} psychic damage.
If you hit a creature that is your size or smaller with a tentacle attack, you can choose to {@action grapple} the creature. The escape DC is equal to your psion spell save DC.

entries: You remain in your Outsider form until you complete a short or long rest, or until you regain at least 1 psi point.

intro: You learn the following spells at the psion levels noted in the table below. These spells count as psion spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Alien Adaptation
entries: Your exposure to aberrant energies continues to change your body in strange and unnatural ways. At 3rd level, you gain an adaptation of your choice from the list below. You gain its effects in both your normal and Outsider forms. You gain another adaptation when you reach 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

items.name: Amorphous Adaptation
entries: Your body is pliable, though you maintain your shape and can use objects as normal. You can squeeze yourself through spaces as narrow as 1 inch wide.

items.name: Amphibious Adaptation
entries: You grow gills and webbing between your digits. You can breath in air and water, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your movement speed.

items.name: Arachnid Adaptation
entries: You grow serrated suckers or small hairs on your limbs. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. You can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings without requiring an ability check.

items.name: Armored Adaptation
entries: our body is covered in viscous mucus or chitinous plates. While you're not wearing armor or wielding a shield, you gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Mutation
entries: Your psionic willpower has grown, and you can exert control over the otherworldly power that resides within your mind. Beginning at 6th level, you can transform into your Outsider form as an action. As long as you have psi points remaining, you can maintain concentration on spells and other features, and you can use an action to revert to your normal form.

subclassFeature.name: Deviant Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action in your Outsider form. You can cast a psion cantrip in place of one of those attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Rift
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use your aberrant power to phase through cracks in reality itself. Immediately after you manifest a psion spell of 1st-level or higher, can teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet that you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Glimpse Beyond the Veil
entries: Beginning at 18th level, you can reveal the otherworldly horrors that lie beyond this reality. As an action, you can force a creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target disappears through an otherworldly gateway into the aberrant void of darkness beyond the stars.

At the end of your next turn, the creature returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not an aberration, it takes {@dice 10d12} psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience. On a success, a creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can do so again. If you have no uses remaining you can spend 5 psi points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Wilder
entries: By far the most volatile psions, Wilders are those who never truly learn to control the wondrous power of their mind. They often discover their psionic abilities unexpectedly as a result of a traumatic event, or violently manifest their mystic power after years of attempting to contain it. Wilders are as erratic as they are powerful, and rarely have psionic masters. By the time these uncontrolled abilities develop, it is often too late to gain control of the torrent of psionic power within them.

subclassFeature.name: Rampant Psionics
entries: Beginning at 1st level, the untamed psionic power within you can have unpredictable effects when unleashed. Immediately after you manifest a psion spell of 1st-level or higher, roll a {@dice d8}. If your roll is equal to the number of psi points you spent to manifest that spell, roll a {@dice d100}. The corresponding effect from the Psionic Surge table immediately takes effect.

entries.caption: Psionic Surge Table
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action.
You float {@dice 1d10} inches off the ground for the next hour
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, a piercing scream comes out of your mouth.
You teleport to a random unoccupied space within 60 feet
You cast {@spell sleep} at the level of the spell that triggered this surge targeting yourself
You can speak only in {@language Deep Speech} for the next minute.
You cast {@spell confusion} targeting yourself. This spell does not require concentration.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@dice 4d10} psychic damage.
You leave footprints that glow with an otherworldly light for the next hour
You are {@condition frightened} by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Roll twice and take the result of your choice
You resist to all damage for the next minute.
You cast {@spell disguise self}, taking on the appearance of the nearest humanoid.
You cast {@spell hypnotic pattern} centered on yourself. This spell does not require concentration.
You cast {@spell levitate} on yourself. This spell does not require concentration.
For the next minute, you regain 5 psi points at the start of each of your turns.
Your skin becomes translucent for 1 minute
You can immediately take one extra action.
Your next spell deals an extra {@dice 1d10} damage
You cast {@spell fly} on a random creature within 60 feet. They must concentrate on this effect.
You emit light in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute
You grow a third spectral arm, which lasts for one hour and is capable of anything your normal arms can do
You briefly see a fond childhood memory of a random creature within 60 feet
You regain all expended Hit Dice
You are proficient in all skills for 1 minute
You cast {@spell invisibility} targeting yourself. This spell doesn't require your concentration
You switch places with the nearest creature
You cannot tell a lie for the next hour
You understand all language for the next hour
You understand no language for the next hour
You cast {@spell blink} on a random creature within 60 feet that you can see
For the next hour, you sprout a third eye in the center of your forehead.
For the next minute, you can see into the Ethereal Plane out to a 30-foot radius
Anytime you deal damage for the next minute, you deal an additional {@dice 1d6} psychic damage
Your jump distance is tripled for one minute
You are {@condition deafened} for the next minute
Your teeth and fingernails fall out and grow back at the end of your next long rest
You loose all distinctive features and appear as an average person of your race.
Maximize the damage of the next spell you cast within the next minute.
Your movement speed is doubled for the next minute.
Your Strength score becomes 4 for one minute.
You regain expended psi points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
You regain all expended psi points.

subclassFeature.name: Inscrutable Mind
entries: The unpredictable psionic storm that is your mind make you difficult for others to dominate. Starting at 1st level, when you make a saving throw to resist being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or have your thoughts read, you have advantage on your roll.

Also, when you succeed on an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can spend 1 psi point and force the attacker to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, it takes psychic damage equal to your psion level.

intro: You learn the following spells at the psion levels noted in the table below. These spells count as psion spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Burst
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when you manifest a psion spell, you can expend extra psi points (up to your Mental Limit) to unleash a burst of psionic energy around you. Creatures within 10 feet of you must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} psychic damage per additional psi point you spent.
The radius of this feature increases as you gain levels in this class; at 14th level (15 feet) and at 18th level (30 feet).

subclassFeature.name: Mental Force
entries: The unbridled power of your mind empowers your spells. Starting at 6th level, when you manifest a psion spell that deals bludgeoning, force, piercing, or psychic damage, roll a {@dice d8} and add the result to one of the spell's damage rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Presence Overwhelming
entries: The torrent of psionic pressure from your mind threatens to mentally overwhelm creatures near you. Beginning at 14th level, creatures within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws to resist the effects of your psion spells and psion abilities. When you reach 18th level the radius of this feature becomes 30 feet.
When you damage a creature with a psion spell, they have disadvantage their saving throw to maintain concentration.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: At 14th level, you gain a limited measure of control over your unbridled power. When you trigger a Psionic Surge, you can roll twice on the table and choose which effect takes place.

subclassFeature.name: Limitless Potential
entries: Your uncontrolled psionic potential is limitless. Beginning at 18th level, when you roll damage for a psion spell and roll the highest result possible on any of the damage dice, you roll that die again, and add its result to your damage roll.
If you roll the highest result possible again, you roll that die again, and continue until you roll less then the highest result.

subclassFeature.name: Bounty Hunter
entries: Bounty Hunters protect humanoids from their own. Trained to hunt in cities and towns, they can track their prey through the dark alleyways and underbelly of any human settlement. Skilled in the use various martial techniques, these rangers are able to confront and subdue any dangerous humanoid.

subclassFeature.name: Combat Superiority
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the following Bounty Hunter features:

items.name: Maneuvers
entries: You learn two maneuvers of your choice from the list at the end of this Archetype. You can use only one maneuver per attack. When you gain a level, you can replace one maneuver you know with another of your choice. You learn one additional maneuver at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

items.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have three {@dice d6} superiority dice. To use a maneuver you must expend one of these dice, and you regain all expended dice when you finish a short or long rest.

As you gain levels in this class your superiority dice grow in size and number. At 7th level you gain a fourth superiority die, and your dice become {@dice d8}s. At 15th level, you gain a fifth superiority die and all of your superiority dice become {@dice d10}s.

items.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

subclassFeature.name: Bounty Hunter Maneuvers
entries: The maneuvers listed below are available to Bounty Hunter rangers, who focus on disabling and restraining their foes.

items.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or roll for initiative, you can expend one superiority die and add it to the roll, provided you aren't surprised or incapacitated.

items.name: Blind
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend a superiority die, forcing a target within 10 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it takes damage equal to your superiority die and is {@condition blinded} until the beginning of your next turn.

items.name: Concussive Blow
entries: When you hit with a creature with an unarmed strike you can expend a superiority die and force them to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Crippling Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend a superiority die, adding it to the damage roll, and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it's speed is reduced to 0 until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Dirty Hit
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die, adding it to the damage roll, and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's movement speed is halved and it cannot take reactions until the beginning of your next turn.

items.name: Trip
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a superiority die, adding it to the damage roll, and if it is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Ear to the Ground
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, when you complete a long rest in a settlement, you have advantage on ability checks to gather information on its contacts, factions, or underworld. You can also identify, read, and communicate in {@language Thieves' Cant}.

subclassFeature.name: Dead or Alive
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when you make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to grapple or shove a creature prone, you gain a bonus to your roll equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering
entries: Starting at 11th level, when a Large or smaller creature misses you with a melee attack, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw as a reaction. On a failed save, it falls {@condition prone}, and if you have a free hand you can automatically grapple the creature as part of the same reaction.

subclassFeature.name: The Most Dangerous Game
entries: Your supernatural instincts allow you to predict your foe's attacks. Starting at 15th level, after you hit a creature with a weapon attack, any time that creature damages you until the start of your next turn, the damage is reduced by an amount equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point).

subclassFeature.name: Buccaneer
entries: Combining their survival skills, affinity for nature magic, and a passion for the high seas, Buccaneers are rangers who feel more at home on water then solid ground. Serving a sailors, pirates, marines or privateers, they are often one of the most valuable crew members on board their vessel. How did you come to sail the seas? Were you pressed into the service of a pirate captain, or have you sworn revenge on a sea monster?

subclassFeature.name: Sea Legs
entries: When you adopt this Archetype at 3rd level, you gain both a climb and swimming speed equal to your movement speed, and you can hold your breath underwater for a number of minutes equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Buccaneer Magic
entries: You learn certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the table below. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Windswept Hide
entries: Your time exposed to the elements on the high seas has made your body more resilient then most. At 7th level you gain resistance to cold damage. If you are already resistant to cold damage you instead gain resistance to your choice of either lightning or thunder damage.
You can also see twice as far as the average member of your race, and you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks when you have a clear line of sight and skies are clear.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Sea Diver
entries: Upon reaching 11th level, you learn to move about the waters as if you were an aquatic creature. While you are underwater, you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action, and you gain {@sense darkvision} out to a 60-foot radius. If you have {@sense darkvision} from another feature its radius increases by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Waves
entries: You bear the watery magic of the high seas whether on sea or land. Beginning at 11th level, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you strike them with watery magic. On hit, you either deal an additional {@dice 1d6} cold damage to the target, or force the creature to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is knocked back 10 feet in a straight line.
Creatures at least one size larger then you have advantage on their saving throw to resist being knocked back.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Resilience
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to temporarily take on a liquid watery form, gaining resistance to all damage from the attack. As part of the same reaction you can immediately move up to your full movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses left, you can spend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to use this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Druidic Guardian
entries: While most rangers stand with a foot in the wild and one in the civilized world, some side firmly with nature. Where cities and industry encroach on ancient groves and wild forests, the rangers known as Druidic Guardians stand as defenders of the wild. Wielding the primeval nature magic, these warriors use the power of the wilderness to defend their homes.

subclassFeature.name: Limited Wildshape
entries: When you adopt this Archetype at 3rd level, you learn to Wild Shape, much like a druid does. You can use a bonus action to assume the form of a beast you have seen before. Your ranger level determines the beasts you can transform into, as shown in the table below. You must follow all the other rules for Wild Shape as detailed in the druid class description.

You can stay in Wild Shape for up to one hour, at which point you revert to your normal form. You can revert to your normal form earlier if you use a bonus action to do so, or if you fall unconscious, you drop to 0 hit points, or you die.
Once you use your Wild Shape you must complete a short or long rest before you can use it again, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to use Wild Shape again.

subclassFeature.name: Druidic Magic
entries: You learn certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the table below. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.
Also, when you learn a ranger spell, you can choose from the druid spell list, and it becomes a ranger spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Friend of the Wild
entries: By 7th level, druidic magic has permeated your body, allowing the wilds to recognize you as friend. You can speak, read, and write {@language Druidic}, the secret language of druids. While speaking Druidic, you are under the effects of {@spell speak with animals}.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Strike
entries: Also starting at 7th level, your attacks while in beast form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian's Grasp
entries: Beginning at 11th level, you can cast {@spell ensnaring strike} without expending a spell slot. You can do so a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You can use this feature while you are in your beast form.

subclassFeature.name: Thousand Forms
entries: You can use druidic magic to change your own form in subtle ways. At 15th level, you learn the spell {@spell alter self}, and can cast it at will, targeting only yourself, without expending a spell slot. It counts as a ranger spell for you, but doesn't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Dunestrider
entries: While all rangers are adept at surviving the wilderness, those known as Dunestriders make survival their life's work. These rugged wanderers have adapted to live in the harshest lands imaginable; arid deserts, frozen tundras, alpine heights with little air to breathe, and dead lands blasted by arcane magic. Donning their signature Wastelander's Cloak and using their affinity for illusions, there is little that can kill a Dunestrider.

entries.name: Elemental Wastelands
entries: While most Dunestriders hail from the deserts of the material plane, it is not unheard of for them to come from the harshest outer planes. Some high-level Dunestriders call the elemental planes home.

subclassFeature.name: Wastelander's Cloak
entries: You are able to survive the most inhospitable environments imaginable. When you adopt this Archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item weaver's tools|phb} and the {@skill Survival} skill.

At the end of a long rest, you can use your {@item weaver's tools|phb} to create a Wastelander's Cloak, a hardy garment that protects your body from the harsh environments you call home. While a creature wears this Cloak they gain the following benefits:

items: They gain a bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide in wasteland environments (like desert, tundra, or blasted lands) equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1).
They require half as much water, and one quarter the amount of food in order to survive each day.
They have advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of harsh environments and subsequent exhaustion levels.

entries: During each long rest, you must spend time maintaining your Wastelander's Cloaks or they fall into disrepair and lose their beneficial properties. You can maintain a total number of Wastelander Cloaks equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Dunestrider Magic
entries: You learn certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the table below. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Rugged Resilience
entries: You can shrug off the harsh effects of elemental assaults. Starting at 7th level, when you are subjected to an effect that deals cold, fire, poison, necrotic, or radiant damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage you would take by an amount equal to your ranger level + your Wisdom modifier.

You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses left, you can spend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to use this reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Strikes
entries: You can use potent illusion magic to enhance your combat abilities. Beginning at 11th level, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to create a temporary illusory duplicate of yourself in a space you can see within 30 feet of you. Your illusory duplicate then makes one weapon attack with an illusory duplicate of your weapon against a target of your choice. On hit, it deals force damage in place of your weapon's normal damage and disappears.

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Transposition
entries: Your skill with illusions has greatly increased. Beginning at 15th level, you can use a bonus action to create your illusory duplicate even when you do not take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Your illusory duplicate must still make an attack.
Also, immediately after your illusory duplicate makes an attack, you can choose to teleport and instantly switch places with your duplicate, without provoking opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Grim Warden
entries: Sometimes it takes a monster to destroy a monster. Rangers that take up the mantle of the Grim Warden undergo a dark alchemical ritual, known as the Warden's Rite, where they inject sinister alchemical compounds into their bloodstream to enhance their physical abilities. They sacrifice any chance for a normal life, mingling their blood with that of monsters, in order to gain sinister power to destroy their foes.

entries.name: Blood Hunter, Dissected
entries: The Blood Hunter class contains many mechanics that are hard to manage, especially for new players. The Grim Warden Archetype attempts to capture the themes and abilities of the base Blood Hunter class while staying in line with the design intent and philosophy of 5th edition.

subclassFeature.name: Warden's Rite
entries: When you adopt this Archetype at 3rd level, you are subjected to the Warden's Rite, an alchemical ritual that suffuses your blood with sinister magic that grants the following benefits:

items: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to a radius of 60 feet. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, it radius increases by 30 feet.
You gain proficiency in {@item alchemist's supplies|phb} and {@skill Religion}.
When you make an Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) check related to fiends, undead, or the dark magic of necromancy, you can add double your proficiency bonus to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Warden Magic
entries: You learn certain spells at the ranger levels noted in the table below. These spells count as ranger spells for you, but they don't count against your total number of Spells Known.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Brand
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you can draw on the vile power within you to empower your weapon attacks with your own blood.
